name.text: Calculating the Volume of a Sphere

questiontext.text:
Find the volume of the figure shown below. Use \(\pi = \frac{22}{7}\) write your answer correct to \(3\,\text{decimal places}\).

[[jsxgraph]] const brd = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-3, 11, 11, -3], axis: false, showCopyright: false, showNavigation: false }); // Sphere parameters const center = brd.create('point', [4, 4], {visible: false}); const r = 4; // radius const a = r; // horizontal radius const b = r * 0.55; // vertical flattening for 3D effect // Main (equatorial) circle (ellipse shape for perspective) const frontEllipse = brd.create('curve', [ t => center.X() + a * Math.cos(t), t => center.Y() + b * Math.sin(t), 0, Math.PI ], {strokeColor: 'blue', strokeWidth: 2, fillColor: 'blue'}); const backEllipse = brd.create('curve', [ t => center.X() + a * Math.cos(t), t => center.Y() + b * Math.sin(t), Math.PI, 2 * Math.PI ], {strokeColor: 'blue', dash: 2, strokeWidth: 2, fillColor: 'blue'}); // Full circular shape (outer boundary) const fullCircle = brd.create('circle', [center, [center.X() + r, center.Y()]], { fillColor: 'white', fillOpacity: 0.8, strokeColor: '#e51d6a', strokeWidth: 2 }); // Radius line (â†”) const edge = brd.create('point', [center.X() + r, center.Y()], {visible: false}); const radiusLine = brd.create('arrow', [center, edge], { strokeColor: 'blue', strokeWidth: 2, firstArrow: {type: 2, size: 6}, lastArrow: {type: 2, size: 6} }); // Radius label brd.create('text', [center.X() + r/2 - 0.5, center.Y() + 0.6, "{#r#} cm"], {fixed:true, fontSize: 16, fontFamily: 'Times' }); [[/jsxgraph]]

\(\text{Volume}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{cm}^3\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]
